title: Is all logic ultimately circular? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is all logic ultimately circular? No, but according to the Anglo-Austrian philospher Ludwig Wittgenstein it is ultimately tautological. The difference? Circular reasoning goes like this: Memphis is in Tennessee, therefore Memphis is in Tennessee. Or like a young friend of mine said when I told him they had found water on the moon, “But they can’t find water on the moon because there’s no water on the moon!” Circular reasoning is a violation of the rules of logic and reasoning, because the conclusion of an argument cannot be used as a premise of the argument. A tautology is different. In a tautology, the predicate restates the subject, but is in different wording. “All bachelors are unmarried men” is a tautology. We learn nothing new after the “are”. If I had written, “All bachelors are rich”, that is not a tautology. The idea of “rich” is not contained in “bachelor”, but “unmarried man” is. All math problems are tautologies. The answer is contained in the problem: 2+3=5. “2+3” and “5” are equivalent. “5” merely restates “2+3”. It doesn’t tell you anything new. “All dogs have tails. Fido is a dog. Therefore Fido has a tail.” This is a tautology. The information “Fido has a tail” is already contained in the two premises. This is why, I think, Wittgenstein said all logic is ultimately tautological. But it is definitely not circular.

Definitions are ultimately circular. Set Theory is a form of logic that can be used to construct classical logic, without which, the concept of Modus Ponens would never be defined, which is the very description for subset in set theory. Bring Category Theory in, and you add to the “primordial goop” from which modern logic constructs itself. Alone, axiomatically, logic suffers no circulatory with other systems, but instead requires invariants that must be assumed to use. These definitions for primitive notions are indeed circular, without some notion to construct them. Somewhere, something must be understood as a primitive concept. In that since, you must understand primitive concepts intuitively, and in concert.
